Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of testing on the increase in COVID-19 cases.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in testing is the sole reason for the rise in cases, without considering other factors.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that increased testing is the only cause of the rise in cases.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation for the increase in cases, suggesting that factors other than testing may be contributing to the rise.
